    • Method Detail

      • fromJson

        public static Network fromJson(org.vertx.java.core.json.JsonObject json)
        Creates a network from JSON.
        Parameters:
        json - A JSON representation of the network.
        Returns:
        A new network instance.
        Throws:
        MalformedNetworkException - If the network definition is malformed.

      • getAddress

        public String getAddress()
        Returns the network address. This is the event bus address at which the network's coordinator will register a handler for components to connect to once deployed.
        Returns:
        The network address.

      • enableAcking

        public Network enableAcking()
        Enables acking on the network. When acking is enabled, network auditors will track message trees throughout the network and notify messages sources once messages have completed processing.
        Returns:
        The called network instance.

      • disableAcking

        public Network disableAcking()
        Disables acking on the network. When acking is disabled, messages will not be tracked through networks. This essentially meands that all messages will be assumed to have been successfully processed. Disable acking at your own risk.
        Returns:
        The called network instance.

      • setAckingEnabled

        public Network setAckingEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets acking on the network.
        Parameters:
        enabled - Whether acking is enabled for the network.
        Returns:
        The called network instance.

      • isAckingEnabled

        public boolean isAckingEnabled()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether acking is enabled.
        Returns:
        Indicates whether acking is enabled for the network.

      • getNumAuditors

        public int getNumAuditors()
        Returns the number of network auditors.
        Returns:
        The number of network auditors.

      • setNumAuditors

        public Network setNumAuditors(int numAuditors)
        Sets the number of network auditors. This is the number of auditor verticle instances that will be used to track messages throughout a network. The Vertigo message tracking algorithm is designed to be extremely memory efficient, so it's unlikely that memory will be an issue. However, if performance of your network is an issue (particularly in larger networks) you may need to increase the number of network auditors.
        Parameters:
        numAuditors - The number of network auditors.
        Returns:
        The called network instance.

      • setAckTimeout

        public Network setAckTimeout(long timeout)
        Sets the network ack timeout. This indicates the maximum amount of time an auditor will hold message information in memory before considering it to be timed out.
        Parameters:
        timeout - An ack timeout.
        Returns:
        The called network instance.

      • getAckTimeout

        public long getAckTimeout()
        Gets the network ack timeout.
        Returns:
        Ack timeout for the network. Defaults to 30000

      • getComponents

        public List<Component<?>> getComponents()
        Gets a list of network components.
        Returns:
        A list of network components.

      • getComponent

        public <T extends Component> Component<T> getComponent(String address)
        Gets a component by address.
        Parameters:
        address - The component address.
        Returns:
        A component instance, or null if the component does not exist in the network.

      • addComponent

        public <T extends Component> Component<T> addComponent(Component<T> component)
        Adds a component to the network.
        Parameters:
        component - The component to add.
        Returns:
        The added component instance.

      • addFeeder

        public Component<Feeder> addFeeder(String address,
                          String moduleOrMain)
        Adds a feeder component to the network.
        Parameters:
        address - The component address. This should be a globally unique event bus address and can be any string.
        moduleOrMain - The feeder component main or module name. Vertigo will automatically detect whether the feeder is a module or a verticle based on module naming conventions.
        Returns:
        The new feeder component instance.

      • addFeeder

        public Component<Feeder> addFeeder(String address,
                          String moduleOrMain,
                          org.vertx.java.core.json.JsonObject config)
        Adds a feeder component to the network.
        Parameters:
        address - The component address. This should be a globally unique event bus address and can be any string.
        moduleOrMain - The feeder component main or module name. Vertigo will automatically detect whether the feeder is a module or a verticle based on module naming conventions.
        config - The feeder component configuration. This configuration will be made available as the verticle configuration within the component implementation.
        Returns:
        The new feeder component instance.

      • addFeeder

        public Component<Feeder> addFeeder(String address,
                          String moduleOrMain,
                          int instances)
        Adds a feeder component to the network.
        Parameters:
        address - The component address. This should be a globally unique event bus address and can be any string.
        moduleOrMain - The feeder component main or module name. Vertigo will automatically detect whether the feeder is a module or a verticle based on module naming conventions.
        instances - The number of feeder instances. If multiple instances are defined, groupings will be used to determine how messages are distributed between multiple component instances.
        Returns:
        The new feeder component instance.

      • addFeeder

        public Component<Feeder> addFeeder(String address,
                          String moduleOrMain,
                          org.vertx.java.core.json.JsonObject config,
                          int instances)
        Adds a feeder component to the network.
        Parameters:
        address - The component address. This should be a globally unique event bus address and can be any string.
        moduleOrMain - The feeder component main or module name. Vertigo will automatically detect whether the feeder is a module or a verticle based on module naming conventions.
        config - The feeder component configuration. This configuration will be made available as the verticle configuration within the component implementation.
        instances - The number of feeder instances. If multiple instances are defined, groupings will be used to determine how messages are distributed between multiple component instances.
        Returns:
        The new feeder component instance.
